data.title: Villebillies ready for Headliners homecoming
data.meta_description: Together for nearly 15 years, the Villebillies have always defied categorization. Now their sound is evolved as they prepare for a homecoming show at Headliners Music Hall.
data.text:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - Together for nearly 15 years, the Villebillies have always defied categorization and mixed genres. Now their sound is evolved as they prepare for a homecoming show at Headliners Music Hall.

Join them Saturday, Nov. 21 at 8 p.m. to welcome them back to the scene.

Fans have enjoyed a couple of recent singles, including "Ride," which showcases the band's evolution.

Demi Demaree sat down with Kyle Meredith on The Setlist, sharing that the band is hoping to drop their next full album in the beginning of 2016.

Hear more of what to expect on that album, including a sample of "Ride," in the video above.

Their homecoming show is for fans 18 and over. Find more information and purchase tickets at headlinerslouisville.com.

To stay updated on the Villebillies next album, follow them on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. All of their music can also be found through their website: villebillies.com.

The Setlist is a collaboration between WFPK Music Director Kyle Meredith and WAVE 3 News Producer Laurel Mallory and is made possible by sponsor Far Out Music. Find more local music by watching WAVE 3 News every Saturday morning or Monday nights at 7:30 p.m.
